column4: Is there some way to get Gnome Classic on Ubuntu 11.10 in a way that is not severely crippled ?
I found that I had that issue too, I am now using gnome 3 happily though so I never bothered fixing classic...
haven't found much that I can call happy in either Gnome 3 or Ubuntu Desktop...
I gave unity about 2 weeks to try and break it in before deciding I didn't like it, then I switched to gnome 3, didn't like it for the first week and now I am addicted!
what causes the addiction ?
faster than unity, much less buggy, awesome looking interface, love that it uses the super key as well... plus with a little fiddling it's as customizable as i wan't!
how do i get hierarchical menus instead of the all-in-one-bunch nonsense ?
(note : Gnome 3 is what i have currently selected. I can't even find where's the system config)
haven't done that as I find simply typing into the search bar a related keyword works wonders, but I can understand you want heirachial menus. try xfce as a window manager
to find the system config without the search bar try: top left button to get app launch interface, then click the applications button (windows will be selected) then down the right side choose system
if I install and use XFCE, do i get full access to GNOME apps ?
Yes, they still run
yeah, i found the system config already. Didn't look at that list, because it didn't even look like it was clickable.
good, glad to hear it, I almost never hit the applications button though, I just use the search bar
i mean i didn't see « System » because it didn't really look like a menu or buttons
no, I understand that, good that you know now though
so now, can I make Alt+Tab work properly ?
alt+tab should work fine in gnome3, unless you can tell me what the specific issue with it is
It groups windows of the same app together. It's slower to make the switch to another window of the same app than going to another app.
just hit the "`" or "~" (tilda) key that is above tab instead of tab
so alt+tab becomes alt+~
this switches between the windows of one application, then hitting alt tab switches between apps
oh GREAT ! :) I was feeling so handicapped, i had the impression of being on OSX.
good to hear, yeh it took me  awhile to figure out too!
